definition: to take an exam
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
surname Ying
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
to beat/to hit/variant of 考[kao3]/to inspect/to test/to take an exam
to check/to verify/to test/to examine/to take an exam/to take an entrance exam for/deceased father

sentences.english: If the results are not for the current year, please indicate that the year of the entry.
sentences.chinese: 如非本年度所考获之成绩，请注明应考年份。

sentences.english: But the study does not recommend that those taking exams use stimulants to boost their heart rate.
sentences.chinese: 但研究并不建议应考学生饮用兴奋剂饮料来增加心率。

sentences.english: All I is study and take exams.
sentences.chinese: 我做的一切就是学习和应考。

sentences.english: All I do is study and take exams.
sentences.chinese: 我做的一切就是学习和应考。

sentences.english: Personnel must score at least 80% on the examination paper.
sentences.chinese: 应考者必须取得至少80%的卷面分。

sentences.english: He's been cramming for his exams all week.
sentences.chinese: 他整个星期都一直在拼命准备应考。

definition: to go and sit an examination
to take an exam
to pass an exam
to take an exam/exam/CL:次[ci4]
to go and take an imperial examination
exam room
the triennial provincial imperial exam during the Ming and Qing
imperial examinations (in former times)
prefectural exam, the 2nd of the three entry-level exams in the imperial examination system of Ming and Qing dynasties
the exam period/the exam date
imperial examination
to win top marks in the imperial examinations
court examination, the top grade imperial exam
candidate who has not yet passed the county level imperial exam
the last of the three entry-level exams in the imperial examination system of Ming and Qing dynasties
autumn exam (triennial provincial exam during Ming and Qing)
